algorithm_technique: Event point sorting (sweep line) to track passenger changes at each location.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a car with limited capacity can complete all passenger trips.
problem_summary_technical: Transforms trips into pickup/dropoff events, sorts them by location, and simulates the journey, checking capacity at each stop.
time_complexity: O(N log N), where N is the number of trips, due to sorting.
space_complexity: O(N), for storing the event points.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as a sweep-line algorithm where events are passenger pickups and drop-offs.
By sorting events by location, we can efficiently track the current number of passengers.
A negative passenger count at any point indicates exceeding capacity.
